results.title: The Animal movie
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sidney Goldsmith, Grant Munro and Ron Tunis
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon to help children explore why and how animals move as they do. A little boy discovers that he cannot compete with animals - monkey, snake, horse etc - by imitating the way they move. He only outdistances them when he climbs into a vehicle that can travel in any environment - proving that, while other animals are trapped by their environment, man, the inventor, isn’t. An award winning film.

results.title: The Animal ark: a refuge for our world's wildlife
results.creator_credit: Freewheelin' Films, American Educational Films and Rodney H. Jacobs
results.brief_description: Tells of the struggle Gerald Durrell has to establish a non profit sanctuary for the preservation of animals on the island of Jersey. He now maintains this unique “zoo” where endangered species of animals are protected from the encroachment of man and eventual extinction.

results.title: The Angel and the Soldier Boy
results.brief_description: On her birthday a little boy is given a piggy bank with a shiny new coin, a picture book and two dolls, an angel and the soldier boy. She makes sure the angel and the soldier boy are safe on her pillow but at night the pirates jump out of the picture book and steal the coin from the piggy bank. The noise wakes the soldier and he chases after them and is taken prisoner. When the angel wakes she goes in search and knows there is something wrong when she finds his sword by the empty piggy bank. Rated: G

results.title: The Angel and the rat
results.creator_credit: Insomnia Films, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Stephen McDonald
results.brief_description: A short documentary which examines certain selected aspects of the personality, ideas and lifestyle of Smiley Williams a young sculptor with emphasis on his personal vision as a clue to understanding his creative process

results.title: The Angel and the devil = Tian shi yu mo gui
results.creator_credit: Pearl River Film Studio and Ling Qiwei
results.brief_description:
Zheng Tian and his gangster friends live life on stealing and robbery. Zheng Tian believes that human nature is half good and half evil, and therefore, his life has two sides. On the one hand, he likes to help people, on the other hand, he commit crimes. Once at a metro station, Zheng Tian comes across a girl who has similar experience as Zheng Tian but has now cut off from her past. The two fall in love and decide to have a new life. But Zhen Tian is tempted by his friends to commit crimes again and is arrested. His girlfriend becomes a member of the Buddhism Association. Zheng Tian understands how his girlfriend has suffered and writes a film script based on his true stories in prison. Towards the end of Zheng Tian’s jail term, he is chosen to play himself in the film and Zheng Tian wants to start a new life with his girlfriend. The film stars Chen Baoguo, who is a leading actor in China and has appeared in many films and TV series.

The film is adapted from well-known Chinese writer, Wang Shuo’s popular novel Half Flame, Half Seawater. Wang Shuo’s work has been translated into many languages and most of his novels have been adapted into films, for example In the Heat of the Sun (dir. Jiang Wen, 1994), Little Red Flowers (dir. Zhang Yuan, 2006) and so on. This film shows that before the 1990s, a lot of PRC films have educational purposes. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The Andes
results.brief_description: An account of the Andes mountain range and its effect on the climate, resources and boundaries of a nation. Illustrates the hazardous crossing of the mountains by foot or horse, pointing out that this difficulty is a barrier to commerce between Chile and Argentina. No other credits available.

results.title: The Ancient world: Egypt
results.creator_credit: Archaelogical Institute of America, American Research Center, Egypt and Ray Garner
results.brief_description: The story of Egypt from the prehistoric period to the time of the Ptolemies. The beginnings of monumental art are shown at Sakkara, the funeral temple and the step pyramid. The glories of the Old Kingdom, the Pyramids, the Sphinx at Giza, and the artistry of the Middle Kingdom are illustrated in detail. Creations of the great Pharoahs are presented; the temples of Karnak and Luxor, the Colossi of Abu Simbel, and the treasures of the city of Akhenaten and the tomb of Tutankhamen. Scenes painted on temple walls showing the life of the ancient Egyptians are included.

results.title: The Ancient Peruvian
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and James Sage
results.brief_description: Explores the art, architecture, religions and society of pre-Columbian culture in Peru. Live footage intercut with animation portrays the rise and fall of these vanished people, and contrasts ancient and contemporary Peru. Music incorporates pre-Columbian harmonies based on scales obtained from tuning clay and reed flutes. Suitable for upper primary levels.

results.title: The Ancient Orient: the Far East
results.brief_description: Shows the relics of early civilizations in India, China, and Japan. From these relics archaeologists have worked out the patterns of culture of these log-buried civilizations. Ceramics, jade carvings, paintings, sculptures and works of architecture are displayed. Gives an insight into the Eastern religions and philosophies which in varying degrees have influenced western life and thought.

results.title: The Ancient Egyptian
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation, Julien Bryan and Leroy Leatherman
results.brief_description: The Egyptian, portrayed through the art he left behind, is shown as a practical, industrious, optimistic lover of life and the world around him. Summarizes Egypt’s primeval past, settlement in the Nile Valley, and history from 2700 BC to the Roman Conquest with an epilogue about the building of the Aswan Dam and the threat to the temple at Abu Simbel.
